question_paper.question_paper_name: IIT M DIPLOMA AN EXAM QDD4 16 Mar
question_paper.question_paper_description: 2025 Mar16: IIT M AN EXAM QDD4

questions.question_text_1: THIS IS QUESTION PAPER FOR THE SUBJECT "DIPLOMA LEVEL : BUSINESS ANALYTICS (COMPUTER BASED EXAM)" ARE YOU SURE YOU HAVE TO WRITE EXAM FOR THIS SUBJECT? CROSS CHECK YOUR HALL TICKET TO CONFIRM THE SUBJECTS TO BE WRITTEN. (IF IT IS NOT THE CORRECT SUBJECT, PLS CHECK THE SECTION AT THE TOP FOR THE SUBJECTS REGISTERED BY YOU)
question_texts: THIS IS QUESTION PAPER FOR THE SUBJECT "DIPLOMA LEVEL : BUSINESS ANALYTICS (COMPUTER BASED EXAM)" ARE YOU SURE YOU HAVE TO WRITE EXAM FOR THIS SUBJECT? CROSS CHECK YOUR HALL TICKET TO CONFIRM THE SUBJECTS TO BE WRITTEN. (IF IT IS NOT THE CORRECT SUBJECT, PLS CHECK THE SECTION AT THE TOP FOR THE SUBJECTS REGISTERED BY YOU)

questions.question_text_1: The probability that a car battery functions for more than 10,000Kms is 0.8, the probability that it functions for more than 20,000kms is 0.4 and the probability that it functions for more than 30,000kms is 0.1. If a new car battery is still working after 10,000Kms, what is the probability that its total life will exceed 20,000Kms? (Note: Enter the answer rounded to two decimal places. For example, if the answer is “0.235”, then enter it as “0.24”)
question_texts: The probability that a car battery functions for more than 10,000Kms is 0.8, the probability that it functions for more than 20,000kms is 0.4 and the probability that it functions for more than 30,000kms is 0.1. If a new car battery is still working after 10,000Kms, what is the probability that its total life will exceed 20,000Kms? (Note: Enter the answer rounded to two decimal places. For example, if the answer is “0.235”, then enter it as “0.24”)

questions.question_text_1: The demand-response curve for a product is expected to be non-linear curve. It is noted that the demand was 1000 units at a price of Rs.80 and 2500 units at a price of Rs. 40. Then, at a price of Rs. 60, what is the expected demand? (Note: Enter the answer rounded to two decimal places. For example, if the answer is “10.235”, then enter it as “10.24”)
question_texts: The demand-response curve for a product is expected to be non-linear curve. It is noted that the demand was 1000 units at a price of Rs.80 and 2500 units at a price of Rs. 40. Then, at a price of Rs. 60, what is the expected demand? (Note: Enter the answer rounded to two decimal places. For example, if the answer is “10.235”, then enter it as “10.24”)

questions.question_text_1: Latent demand in a demand-response curve is the area obtained when?
question_texts: Latent demand in a demand-response curve is the area obtained when?

options.option_text: Price is reduced below the identified optimal price
Price is increased beyond the identified optimal price
The optimal price is increased beyond the maximum available price
Quantity is reduced below the identified optimal quantity
Quantity is increased beyond the identified maximum quantity

questions.question_text_1: You solve the primal of a linear program with a maximization objective, three decision variables and two constraints of the less than or equal to type. Non-negativity restrictions apply to the decision variables. After solving the linear program, you find that the first constraint is not binding (LHS < RHS) and the second constraint is binding (LHS = RHS). Which of the following statements is/are correct?
question_texts: You solve the primal of a linear program with a maximization objective, three decision variables and two constraints of the less than or equal to type. Non-negativity restrictions apply to the decision variables. After solving the linear program, you find that the first constraint is not binding (LHS < RHS) and the second constraint is binding (LHS = RHS). Which of the following statements is/are correct?

options.option_text: There are three decision variables in the dual
The dual variable corresponding to the second constraint is zero
There are two decision variables in the dual formulation
The dual variable corresponding to the second constraint is non-zero

questions.question_text_1:
(The following comprehension is purely imaginary)

“FUNKY” is a compay that manufactures purses, shoes and backpacks. The construction of the three products requires leather and synthetic material, with leather being the limiting raw material. The production process uses two types of skilled labour: Sewing and Polishing. Table-2 gives the availability of the resources, the usage in the three products and the profits per unit.
questions.question_text_2:
(The following comprehension is purely imaginary)

“FUNKY” is a compay that manufactures purses, shoes and backpacks. The construction of the three products requires leather and synthetic material, with leather being the limiting raw material. The production process uses two types of skilled labour: Sewing and Polishing. Table-2 gives the availability of the resources, the usage in the three products and the profits per unit. 
  Given the above information, formulate the problem as a linear program to maximize the profit and answer the subquestions.

questions.question_text_1: The estimated demand for a product follows the relationship: D(p) = 2570 - 4p. Where “p” is the selling price of the product. With this information answer the given subquestions.
question_texts: The estimated demand for a product follows the relationship: D(p) = 2570 - 4p. Where “p” is the selling price of the product. With this information answer the given subquestions.

questions.question_text_1: If you intend to maximize the revenue, what is the best value for “p”? (Note: Enter the answer rounded to two decimal places. For example, if the answer is “10.235”, then enter it as “10.24”)
